page.title: 08Industry: Rosneath (1)
page.content: Boatbuilding: There are two yards, now mainly repairing and storage. MCGRUER founded 1911. Formerly builders in wood of fine yachts and dinghies,now mostly fit out fibre-glass hulls due to cost and scarcity of timber, especially hard woods.As result skills in handling wood for building dis- appearing as workers retire. Company employs approx.60, 5 of whom travel from Dunoon since closure of Sandbank yard. Remainder from Dumbarton, Helensburgh & Peninsula. Mr James McGruer member of Olympic Yachting Com SILVERS:formerly builders in wood of fine motor boats, yard now only repairs and storage. Larger jetty built l984. Sponsoring 1985 series of races with CYCA in endeavour to re- establish Saturday racing on Clyde.
